WRITING.TITLE: Some suggestions for all the things rural players need.
WRITING.TEXT:
So my apologies for the long post, but here's my thoughts on the things that people actually need in the game:
* Wild spawns * Items / Pokstops * Stardust and XP * Regional exclusives * Legendary / unreleased Pokmon.
I think there's many ways that these things can be handled so that rural players and anyone else without easy access to everything in the game can still enjoy something. I hope Niantic makes some changes with regards to this. But here's what I think.
-----
**Wild spawns**
If Niantic cannot increase spawns in rural areas or re-distribute spawns fairly, then here's my simple suggestion on how to make spawns fair.
If...
* your game has been open and running for 30 minutes * not a single Pokmon has appeared in nearby or sightings * with distance tracking etc summarising the entire 30 minutes, you are within the speed limit (basically if your point at the start, and your point at the end can be travelled within the speed limit) * you have not yet received your daily catch streak for the day
... you should have an automatic incense spawn. That's it. Just one spawn. That way, this isn't really a way to cheat etc, but for rural players who just want ONE catch for the day to continue their streak, you get something without having to travel a million kilometers. If it runs away, this won't screw you over because you haven't yet gotten your daily catch so you would have to wait another 30 minutes if you want another spawn without going to a better area.
-----
**Pokstops / Items**
If Niantic cannot re-distribute Pokstops or add stops to rural areas then...
* if your game has been open and running for 30 minutes * if there are no Pokstops on your entire map * you have not yet received your daily Pokstop streak
... a temporary one-time-use Pokstop should appear within your trainer scan circle (within swiping range). That's it. Just one. That way, rural players can still continue their streak and get at least a few items for the day. This Pokstop will work like an incense spawn where only you can see it. Instead of turning purple when it has been swiped, it will disappear. If the player has no Pokeballs of any kind, at least one Pokball is guaranteed in this swipe.
-----
**Stardust and XP**
This has been suggested so many times and I don't understand why it hasn't come up from Niantic yet... but we need some sort of mini-game.
So, with the above two suggestions, every player should still receive daily stardust and XP. However, for rural players, this means that there will be nothing to do after this single point of the day. Many people have suggested mini-games and AR-related additions.
Here's my suggestion:
**HIDE-AND-SEEK.**
A Pokmon you choose from your storage will play hide-and-seek with you. Why this type of game? Because this will still require you to physically move around and thus falls under the theme of the game.
* Once you start the hide-and-seek game, you will see a different version of your normal map.
* On this map, you'll see NO WILD SPAWNS, POKSTOPS or GYMS. You WILL however see random obstacles and hiding places (rocks, trees, a tiny abandoned shack, etc.). All of this will load in the entire map area you had when you clicked to start the hide-and-seek game.
* Possible hiding spots will defer depending on the size of your chosen Pokmon. (Weedle may be hiding behind a fire hydrant or a small bush. Snorlax may be hiding behind a shack or a large tree.)
* On the map, you'll need to be within range of the possible hiding spot to examine it. There is a small chance that you will find your buddy, a small chance that you will find stardust or an item and a very large chance that you will find nothing. Either way, the hiding spot will disappear and if you haven't found your buddy, you'll have to search at another spot. Straying too far away from the hide-and-seek area will end the game, or at any time, you can give up.
* When you have found your buddy, you will get a small amount of stardust and XP. At most, it should be the same 100XP and 100 Stardust as catching a Pokmon.
* While moving faster than the speed limit, you will not be able to examine a hiding spot.
* Distance will be tracked as normal while in the hide-and-seek arena. At the end of the game, your distance will be added to your current egg(s) accordingly.
* Perhaps after finding your buddy, as another reward, you would get to see them in a small photo arena similar to the catch screen where you can take a photo of them with or without AR.
-----
**Regional exclusives**
Despite the appeal of exclusives being rare and... well... exclusive... I don't understand why this would be something so limited. If the suggestion is to literally travel to another part of the world, I'm sure Niantic should understand that most players do not have the ability to do that.
Either every part of the world should have their own exclusive Pokmon or everyone should eventually have some opportunity to catch them. I can't say Niantic won't do this as they've already shown that they are adding regionals and may possibly choose to migrate them. I hope they do, but make sure to spread them out evenly so anyone in the world can participate.
-----
**Legendary Pokmon**
I am extremely worried about this. If Europe can be the only people to get Mr Mime, South America the only people to get Heracross, etc... what stops Niantic from simply releasing Mew in only one part of the world? How will any rural player have a chance of getting this?
I personally believe legendary events should be related to GYMS. This way, nobody will be left out. If you have to travel a bit to find your nearest gym, I think it's only fair, as opposed to EVERYONE having to go to the Empire State Building or something.
Suggestion 1:
* Every player gets flagged for whether they already have or have not completed the event for the legendary Pokmon and will see gyms differently depending on that.
* If not completed, they will see every gym around them as a legendary event. The entire gym game will be unavailable to people who have not competed yet (but you will still be able to collect coins from existing gym positions you hold).
* The legendary event gym will be scaled to your level and your highest 6 Pokmon's CP.
* The gym will work in a similar way to a normal gym except the top Pokmon will be a scaled-CP version of the legendary in question.
* The way the fight and the team at the gym work is up to Niantic. Perhaps it can be Team Rocket as many have suggested. Perhaps they will all be the legendary Pokmon and you'll fight it 6 times. Either way, it should be difficult and may even require multiple fights like taking down a gym. It should be difficult enough that not everyone should easily win it the first time.
* Either way, after winning the event, an egg with that legendary Pokmon will be awarded to the player. Perhaps it could be a much higher distance requirement. 25km or even 50km seems fair to me.
-----

WRITING.TITLE: [Discussion] Why is Niantic still pretending the speed limits are secret when we all know about them?
WRITING.TEXT:
I find it ~~ridiculous~~ frustrating that there's no indication of whether you're able or not able to accumulate egg distance at your current speed.
I find it ~~ridiculous~~ frustrating that Pokstops say "Try again later" when you're moving too quickly, even though they also say that when anything else goes wrong.
And most of all, I find it ~~ridiculous~~ frustrating that the Nearby/Sightings tab still says "No Sightings yet" when you're moving too fast. Even though there could actually be no Pokmon around you. You wouldn't know until you wasted more time double-checking.
All of these (and many more) parts of the game have triggers or flags to tell you when you're moving too fast to use them.
Why does it not directly say that anywhere on the app apart from the annoying pop-up that doesn't make sense?
My phone is GPS drifting while I'm sitting on my couch? Yes, I'm a passenger. Not sure why they can't change this silly phrase.
Why does it not say "Moving too fast to keep egg comfortable" on the egg screen?
Why does it not say "Moving too fast to check this Pokstop for items" when you try to swipe it?
Why does it not say "Moving too fast to detect nearby Pokmon" on our Nearby/Sightings tab.
I feel like this was purposely left out and confused people who didn't understand why their Pokstop kept saying "Try again later"
Niantic should simply add in these minor messages or indicators. Even some kind of blinking light or static on the nearby tab would make more sense. I feel like it's less immersive because of this lack of communication.
I understand there's a pop-up message for speed limits, but that's pretty annoying and it doesn't directly show you what you can and cannot use. All the messages or responses in parts of the game that actually are affected by speed-locks give a generic error that could refer to anything.
Anyone else feel this could be made better?

**EDIT:** Sorry if I sound like a whiny little kid. I wrote this while in a bad mood. My bad. Anyway, I'm not saying I disagree with the speed limits. I'm saying I disagree with the way we have to realise or figure out what it affects. Niantic literally has programming to detect the specific things that it needs to disable. Why can't those same points of detection be used to change the messages that it sends us? I want them to point out what is disabled because of the speed limit.
